string.value: Loads an ASP.NET User Control
The path to the User Controls .ascx file, like “~/Controls/MyControl.ascx”
Lets you specify constant boolean value
Lets you specify constant date and time value
Lets you specify constant decimal value
Lets you specify constant Guid value
Lets you specify constant integer value
Lets you specify constant string value
Lets you visually specify a Xhtml document constant
Adds a new instance of the given type.
Updates instance(s) with the given values.
Deletes instance(s) with the given filter.
Creates a DataReference based on a key value.
The key value of the data to reference.
Key value
Creates a NullableDataReference based on a key value. The default value is 'null', no reference.
The key value of the data to reference.
Key value
Converts a DataReference into a single element filter. This filter will select a maximum of one item.
The Data Reference to use when selecting data.
Data Reference
Lets you select data based on its reference to the currently rendered page.
Select what relation the current page must have with the data you wish to retrieve.
Page scope
Defines an “and” or “or” query, combining two other filters.
And / or filter
If you select “And” both filters are applied to the data. Selecting “Or” will give you the data that matches just one of the filters.
One of the two filters (the one to evaluate first)
Left filter
One of the two filters (the one to evaluate last)
Right filter
Lets you specify a filter on data by specifying requirements for the individual fields. If you set requirements on multiple fields, they are all enforced (and query).
Retrieves an XML representation of the data.
Element name
Element namespace
When selected the data XML will be preceded by a <PagingInfo /> element detailing number of pages, items and more.
Include paging info
The field to order data by
Order by
When set to true results are delivered in ascending order, otherwise descending order is used. Default is ascending order.
Order ascending
If the number of data elements exceed the page size you can use paging to move to the other pages. See the Page size parameter.
Page number
The number of items to display on one page – the maximum number of elements to return.
Page size
The data fields to output in the XML. Fewer fields can yield faster renderings.
Selected fields

If you include reference data in the 'Selected properties' setting, you can use this option to control how the referenced data is included. 'Inline' is easy to use, but may bloat the size of the XML document.
Show reference data inline

When true data can be ordered randomly. Specify the number of random results you require by setting the 'Page size'. If a filter is specified, this is applied before the random selection. If you specify an 'Order by' value, you should specify a low 'Page size' or the randomization will become void.
Determines if result XML has to be cached, and what priority those cache records should have
Cache Priority
Fetches the ID of the current page or a page relative to the current page.
What page to get id from. The default is from the current page.
Page association
Quick and raw sitemap xhtml.

Returns a hierarchical XML structure of pages. When executed as part of a page rendering XML elements representing the current and ancestor pages will be appended the attributes isopen=”true” and iscurrent=”true”
Source page

By default the source page is the page currently being rendered. Specify a value if you want to get sitemap information relative to another page. The source page controls how page elements are annotated with 'isopen' and 'iscurrent' and is the starting point when calculating the page scope.
Page scope
The scope of pages to extract from the sitemap. The default is 'all pages'. You can use this parameter to extract the structure you need to complete your task.
Gets information about current page in all the languages.

Defines a 'cache zone' around a function call or markup (typically containing function calls). This function can be used to enhance page rendering performance by caching sections of a web page. The 'Object Cache Id' value should be unique to the content being cached.
Object to cache
What you want to cache - this can be a single function call or a section of markup containing one or more function calls.
Unique cache id
Specify an ID unique to the content being cached. This value is used - in conjunction with the Page scope - to define a unique cache key.
Page scope
The page scope the cached data should be shared on. By default the page scope is 'this website', but you can change it to page specific caching and more.
Cache duration (seconds)
The number of seconds the cached object should be reused. Default is 1 minute (60 seconds).
Language specific
Choose if the cached object should be uniquely cached per website language or commonly shared among languages.
Compares two objects for equality. Returns true if the two objects are equal.
Value A to compare.
Value B to compare.
Value A to compare.
Value B to compare.
Reads a string from the application configuration file (web.config or app.config)
Key Name
Add a number of days to the current date and get the resulting date.
Specify a negative or positive number of days to add to the current date.
Days to add
The current date and time
Returns an input parameter from executing function context. Use this in developing to copy an input value to a new function call.
Specify the name of the input parameter which value you wish to use here.
Parameter name
Parses a string into an object. The type of object depends on the receiver. Using this function to deliver a value to a DateTime parameter, will make the system parse the string as a DateTime etc.
Specify the string to parse. Note that the string must be formatted in a way that can be converted into the type of object that is expected.
String to parse
Returns a new random Guid.
A list of all cultures
The culture for the current user / request.
Returns the sum from a list of integers
Integer list

True if the current request is identified as coming from a crawler (search engine).
True if the current request is identified as coming from a mobile device.
Common HTML meta tags you probably want in your html head
By default this is 'text/html; charset=utf-8'. If you serve something else you should overwrite this.
Who designed this website? Show it in the 'Designer' meta tag. Default is not to emit the meta tag.
Show generator
Show the world you support Composite C1 - free open source!
Appends a lang='(language code)' attribute the the parent element, reflecting the language of the current page. You can put this just below the <html /> tag.
Includes a named Page Template Feature at this location. Page Template Features can contain HTML and functional snippets and are managed on the Layout perspective.
Feature name
The name of the Page Template Feature you wish to include.

Emits the 'definitive title' of the current page; the same value that ends up in the page title tag. This title may originate from the page being rendered or from a C1 Function/ASP.NET control which changed the title to match specific data being featured on the page.
Prefix to be removed
If the HTML title has a prefix value you wish to get rid of, specify the prefix here. If the prefix is not found in the title, this value is ignored.
Postfix to be removed
If the HTML title has a postfix value you wish to get rid of, specify the postfix here. If the postfix is not found in the title, this value is ignored.

Emits the 'definitive description' of the current page; the same value that ends up in the page meta description tag. This value may originate from the page being rendered or from a C1 Function/ASP.NET control which changed the description to match specific data being featured on the page.
Element to wrap description

To have the description wrapped in an element (like

) specify it here. The element with only be emitted when a description text exist.
Gets a value from the current users cookie collection.
Cookie name
If the user does not have this cookie, use this field to specify what value to default to.
Fallback value

Returns additional information passed in a URL along with the page link.
The segment of the path info to retrieve, using the format '/(0)/(1)/(2)/...'. Specify -1 to get the entire string.
When true, any path info string will be accepted. Default is true.
Fallback value
Extracts an integer value from a PathInfo segment.
The segment of the path info to retrieve, using the format '/(0)/(1)/(2)/...'.
When true, any path info string will be accepted. Default is true.
Fallback value
Extracts a GUID from a PathInfo segment.
The segment of the path info to retrieve, using the format '/(0)/(1)/(2)/...'.
When true, accept any path info string will be accepted. Default is true.
Fallback value
Notifies the system of PathInfo being used, so that the request is not redirected to the 'Page not found' page.
Retrieves a variable from the current users session as a string.
The value to use if the session variable was not found
Fallback value
Variable name
Redirects the website visitor to another URL. URL redirects are suppressed when this function executes inside the C1 console.
The URL the user should be redirected to, either absolute (http://contoso.com/default.aspx) or relative (/Login.aspx)).
Sets a cookie value for the current user
The name of the cookie to set / overwrite
Cookie name
The value to store in the cookie
Cookie value
When the cookie should expire (stop to exist). The default value is 'session', when the user closes the browser.

Sets the maximum number of seconds the current page should be publicly cached on the server. To ensure that the page response is not cached set the "Maximum seconds" to "0". If multiple sources set the server cache duration, the smallest number is used. Note that the file "~/Renderers/Page.aspx" contains a default value for cache duration – you can edit this file to change the default.

The maximum number of seconds the page currently being rendered should be publicly cached. A high value yield good performance, a low value make changes show up faster. A value of '0' ensure that all visitors get a unique response.
Maximum seconds
Sets a session variable for the current user
The name of the session variable to set.
Variable name

Gets the web application virtual path. Typically this is '' - the empty string, when running in the website root, but if {applicationname} is running in a sub folder this can be '/MySubfolder'. You can use this value to prefix URL's so they will work no matter is {applicationname} is running is a subfolder or not. Sample XSLT usage:
Gets an IIS application variable
Value to use if the application variable was not located
Fallback value
Variable name
Gets the value of an IIS Server variable
The IIS Server variable to get.
Variable name

The relative path of the XML file to load
Relative path

The relative path of the XHTML file to load
Relative path
Loads a remote XML file given a Url
Time period in seconds for which the result should is cached. Default is 0 (no caching).
Seconds to cache
Provides localized date formatting functions for XSLT use.
Provides globalization functions for XSLT use.

Provides functions that parse encoded XML documents or XHTML fragments into nodes. Use this extension when you have XML or XHTML as a string and need to copy it to the output or do transformations on it.
Sends an e-mail. Remember to configure SMTP server connection in the web.config file.
Sender's address.
Recipient. A list of comma separated email addresses.
Email subject.
Email body.
Defines whether email to be sent is an HTML email or a text email.
Carbon Copy. A list of comma separated email addresses that are secondary recipients of a message.
Address that should be used to reply to the message.
Blind Carbon Copy. A list of recipients which will receive a mail but their individual email addresses will be concealed from the complete list of recipients.

List of attached files. 
 Format it the following [{name}=]{filepath}[,{mime-type] [ | .... ]. 
 File path can be either relative or absolute path f.e. "C:\someimage.jpg" or "/coolpicture.jpg" 
 If file path starts with "Composite/", it will be recognized as a path to Composite media, f.e. 'Composite/MediaArchive:someImage.gif' 
 
 Examples: 
 /attachment.jpg 
 image.jpg=/attachment.jpg 
 image.jpg=/attachment.jpg,image/jpg 
 image1.jpg=/attachment1.jpg,image/jpg|image2.jpg=/attachment2.jpg,image/jpg
A file from media library to be attached.
Filters images by it's folder path
Media Folder
A reference to a media folder
Include Subfolders
Determines whether images from subfolders should be included.
Filters images by it's folder path
Media Folder
A reference to a media folder
Include Subfolders
Determines whether media files from subfolders should be included.
Converts an enumerable of XElements to a Dictionary using named attributes for keys and values.
An enumerable of XElements that will be used to create a dictionary from.
Key Attribute Name
The name of the attribute on each XElement which value will be used for keys in the dictionary.
Value Attribute Name
The name of the attribute on each XElement which value will be used for values in the dictionary.
Converts an enumerable of objects to a Dictionary using named property names for keys and values.
An enumerable of objects that will be used to create a dictionary from.
Key Property Name
The name of the property on each object which value will be used for keys in the dictionary.
Value Property Name
The name of the property on each object which value will be used for values in the dictionary.
